newsitem.title: DUBAI: Tehran mayor says capital facing pollution problem.
newsitem.headline: Tehran mayor says capital facing pollution problem.

text.p: Air pollution caused by car exhaust fumes in Tehran is reaching dangerous proportions, the mayor of Iran's capital said on Saturday.

"Gholamhussein Karbaschi said here on Saturday that toxic gases in Tehran's atmosphere as a result of emissions from petrol-driven vehicles is twice the per capita amount in other developing countries," Iran's official news agency IRNA said.

Speaking at an international conference on air pollution, Karbaschi said 39 percent of transportation in Tehran was by car, which he said was high compared to other cities which struggle with pollution, such as Mexico City.
Karbaschi said 10 million tonnes of fossil fuels were burnt each year by vehicle engines in Tehran.
